subject: RE: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
body:
ODOT responded.  
 
Contact for ODOT:
 
Jim Gamble
District 5 Manager 
ODOT, Region 2
2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477
Office: 541-726-2541
 
 
 
Jake Burke
Captain � Investigations Division
Eugene Police Department
300 Country Club Road
Eugene, Oregon 97401
(541) 682-5895 work
 
 

 
From: BURKE Jacob T 
Sent: Friday, April 18, 2025 11:37 AM
To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov>; Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com>
Cc: Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com>; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com>; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com>
Subject: RE: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
 
Here is the list of contacts requested in the original email.  
 
1.	For Right of Way (ROW) on City of Eugene (COE) property: 
 
Contact:  Byron Williams (Technical specialist Public Works) 541-682-4893  brwilliams@eugene-or.gov brwilliams@eugene-or.gov .  
                      Bret Jones (Traffic Engineering)  541-682-4908  bjones@eugene-or.gov bjones@eugene-or.gov .        
 
*	No permit needed but must �call in a locate� to Byron Williams prior to install.  Need to coordinate with Bret Jones before placing pole to ensure doesn�t impede their equipment.  
 
2.	Attaching cameras to COE owned and maintained signals/poles: 
 
Contact:  Bret Jones to coordinate.  No permit needed
 
3.	Attaching cameras to ODOT owned COE maintained signals/poles: 
 
Contact: Bret Jones to coordinate.  No permit needed
 
4.	Attaching cameras or poles on ROW for LCSO owned locations: 
 
Contact:  Mr. Shashi Bajracharya.  He has been notified by Bret Jones and has already been working with Flock for Springfield and LCSO locations. 
 
5.	ODOT owned ROW locations
 
Unknown-  I have an email to the regional manager but I haven�t heard back.  Bret thinks we can work through things at those locations so he may be a good starting point.  
 
 
Jake Burke
Captain � Investigations Division
Eugene Police Department
300 Country Club Road
Eugene, Oregon 97401
(541) 682-5895 work
 
 

 
From: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > 
Sent: Tuesday, April 15, 2025 2:05 PM
To: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com >
Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
Subject: RE: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
 
I have approved all of the locations that were pending in the deployment plan.
 
Captain Burke is out of the office this week but would be the person to provide those contacts requested below. 

Derek
 
Detective D. DeWitt
Financial Crimes Unit
Special Weapons and Tactics Team
Background Investigations Team
Eugene Police Department
300 County Club Road
Eugene, OR 97401
Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
Work Cell � 541-743-6192
 

 
From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 2:46 PM
To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
Subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
 
[EXTERNAL ?]
Hi Detective DeWitt,

 
Happy Monday. You may review the further update locations on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c582f3f20f3ed75482b4921ad0ea050e9bd14be901319e012fda77ce9841fe2a225000a82f04682cbd8968fb4de93738f038 . Please let me know if you have any more questions on these or if you approve of the placements.
 
Quick couple questions from me:
- Do you have a contact at the city we can reach out to for permitting?
- Same question as above, just for a county contact
- What is the most recent update on permitting/approvals for the ODOT locations? Do we need to be looped in on comms with them at this time? I recall on the KO call it was mentioned that Eugene and ODOT were going back and forth on some things.
 
Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
 
 
On Fri, Apr 11, 2025 at 2:13?PM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
	P44 can stay, lets just move it as close to the green line as possible.
	 
	P52 is in the City of Eugene, but Lane County has pockets of jurisdiction all around this particular stretch of town.  There is no City of River Road.  It would be Lane County, which is also signing with Flock.  I don�t image any issues with permitting as Flock will already be working with them for their install�s.  
	
	Derek
	 
	Detective D. DeWitt
	Financial Crimes Unit
	Special Weapons and Tactics Team
	Background Investigations Team
	Eugene Police Department
	300 County Club Road
	Eugene, OR 97401
	Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
	Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
	Work Cell � 541-743-6192
	 
	
	 
	From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
	Sent: Friday, April 11, 2025 11:52 AM
	To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
	Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
	Subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
	 
	[EXTERNAL ?]
	Hi Detective,
	
	 
	I got your feedback on these two locations in front of our Deployment team. 
	 
	P44 can be moved more east, but then it will be right in someone's front yard. We can install there though. We will just need permission from the property owner. Should we move forward with updating your map? In the pic below, the green is not viable for install due to solar obstacles. The red area, someone's front yard, is good for install
	
	
	P52 Everything east of the red line is city of River Road ROW. We can move it east if they are willing to permit us. Do you think they would approve of this?
	
	 
	The yellow icons in the above show where the cameras are at now. Please let me know if you have any questions.
	
	Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
	 
	 
	On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 12:08?PM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
		I went through and approved the majority of the locations you sent. The following I have questions/adjustments for.
		 
		P044 at W 18th Street @ Cleveland St WB.  Can this one be moved more to the East?  The idea would be to catch a vehicle either in the turn lane to go North on Arthur or East on W 18th Avenue.  With it set back how it is, we miss this information.
		 
		P052 at Maxwell Road @ Maxwell Connector EB.  Can this also be moved more to the East?  How its stationed now we miss anyone coming off of the Maxwell Connector.  I would prefer it in a location between the Maxwell Connector and N. Park Avenue still looking to the East.
		 
		Derek
		 
		Detective D. DeWitt
		Financial Crimes Unit
		Special Weapons and Tactics Team
		Background Investigations Team
		Eugene Police Department
		300 County Club Road
		Eugene, OR 97401
		Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
		Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
		Work Cell � 541-743-6192
		 
		
		 
		From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
		Sent: Thursday, April 10, 2025 11:15 AM
		To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
		Subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
		 
		[EXTERNAL ?]
		Detective,
		 
		Apologies for the quick follow up. There are also a few other locations we'd like you to get your eyes on to approve the placement. Those locations are: F010, F019, F021, F039, F015
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
		 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
		 
		 
		On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 11:11?AM Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > wrote:
			Detective DeWitt,
			
			 
			The location has been updated. Please review it on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c582560303a6c2e3e60326f43777d51bbdd9e1bdc878e527a9fa0d2d6abff6fb4732a1214533e1b5baac57072823bc00b731  and let me know if you approve of its placement. Once you approve we can add it to the locations that require a city permit.
			 
			Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
			 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
			 
			 
			On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 6:59?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
				Here are the coordinates. 
				(44.0404460, -123.1247610)
				 
				Derek
				 
				Detective D. DeWitt
				Financial Crimes Unit
				Special Weapons and Tactics Team
				Eugene Police Department
				300 County Club Road
				Eugene, OR 97401
				Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
				Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
				Work Celll � 541-743-6192
				
________________________________

				From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com >
				Sent: Thursday, April 10, 2025 5:35:43 AM
				To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
				Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
				Subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety 
				 
				[EXTERNAL ?]
				Hi Detective,
				 
				Understood and thank you for taking the time to look into it. GPS coordinates always help us get placement right the first time and avoid any back and forth. To get the coordinates, right click on the preferred install location on Google maps and then copy the coordinates that come up. Once you share these with me I can have your map updated.
				 
				Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
				 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
				 
				 
				On Wed, Apr 9, 2025 at 10:52?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
					I don�t know if I am going to be able to get to yes with the private property request for the location we spoke about along I-5.  Reading through the ODOT setbacks allowed for property owners, I believe it would work, I just don�t know if I am going to be able show it which obviously would be an issue.  So lets move that camera, so we can complete the mapping and permitting process without delay.
					 
					After looking at our best available options, I would like to place that camera on West 18th Avenue, looking East, just prior to Arthur Street with the intent to capture vehicles in the turn lane to northbound Arthur Street and eastbound West 18th Avenue.  
					 
					Let me know if you have questions about the exact placement or any issues with that intersection.  
					
					Derek
					 
					Detective D. DeWitt
					Financial Crimes Unit
					Special Weapons and Tactics Team
					Background Investigations Team
					Eugene Police Department
					300 County Club Road
					Eugene, OR 97401
					Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
					Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
					Work Cell � 541-743-6192
					 
					
					 
					From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
					Sent: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 1:10 PM
					To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >
					Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
					Subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
					 
					[EXTERNAL ?]
					HI Detective,
					
					 
					Thank you for taking my call about location F015. Per it, you are going to see about locating a parcel map showing the boundaries of this private property. Our records show the property line starting at about 70' from the I-5 which is too far for our cameras. You thought this might be inaccurate so once you are able to gather a little more info, we should be able to clear up where the property lines are and what the best install location will be.
					 
					Regards
					 
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
					 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
					 
					 
					On Tue, Apr 8, 2025 at 10:31?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
					Good morning,
					 
					I checked the Deployment Tracker map and it looks like all updates were added with the exception of one.  F#015 is a duplicate of one just further to the West.  We were moving that one to private property to catch a view of I-5 southbound.  That camera location will be 89733 Armitage Road (Johnson Vegetable Farms).  I sent pictures and Google map pins to show the purposed location in a previous email.  I just wanted to make sure that was on your radar.  We have verbal permission from the property owner who said he would sign the associated form.  I can provide his name and phone number as well.
					 
					Thank you all for your continued work on this,
					
					Derek
					 
					Detective D. DeWitt
					Financial Crimes Unit
					Special Weapons and Tactics Team
					Background Investigations Team
					Eugene Police Department
					300 County Club Road
					Eugene, OR 97401
					Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
					Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
					Work Cell � 541-743-6192
					 
					
					 
					From: Matt Triana <matt.triana@flocksafety.com matt.triana@flocksafety.com > 
					Sent: Wednesday, April 2, 2025 2:55 PM
					To: DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov >; BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >
					Cc: Emily Atzen <emily.atzen@flocksafety.com emily.atzen@flocksafety.com >; Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com >; David Johnson <david.johnson@flocksafety.com david.johnson@flocksafety.com >
					Subject: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
					 
					[EXTERNAL ?]
					Hi Captain & Detective,
					 
					Thank you all for your time today on the kick off call.
					 
					To recap, we are installing: 57 of our LPR cameras on a mix of existing poles, standard 12' Flock poles, and MASH test poles (ODOT locations). The majority of these fall within city and county ROWs with a handful falling ODOT ROW. Per our call, at this time we are pending the official 'yes' from ODOT.
					 
					Our permitting team is diligently working to secure the necessary approvals. We acknowledge that this process can be time-consuming, and we assure you that we will provide timely updates as soon as permit approvals are obtained. If you come across contacts for anyone within 
					 
					Here is also the deployment tracker link we discussed. The Deployment Tracker [link https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker ] will be your go-to resource for

ODOT responded.  
 
Contact for ODOT:
 
Jim Gamble
District 5 Manager 
ODOT, Region 2
2080 Laura Street Springfield OR 97477
Office: 541-726-2541
 
 
 
Jake Burke
Captain � Investigations Division
Eugene Police Department
300 Country Club Road
Eugene, Oregon 97401
(541) 682-5895 work

thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]
	Hi Detective,
	
	 
	I got your feedback on these two locations in front of our Deployment team. 
	 
	P44 can be moved more east, but then it will be right in someone's front yard. We can install there though. We will just need permission from the property owner. Should we move forward with updating your map? In the pic below, the green is not viable for install due to solar obstacles. The red area, someone's front yard, is good for install
	
	
	P52 Everything east of the red line is city of River Road ROW. We can move it east if they are willing to permit us. Do you think they would approve of this?
	
	 
	The yellow icons in the above show where the cameras are at now. Please let me know if you have any questions.
	
	Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
	 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
	 
	 
	On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 12:08?PM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
		I went through and approved the majority of the locations you sent. The following I have questions/adjustments for.
		 
		P044 at W 18th Street @ Cleveland St WB.  Can this one be moved more to the East?  The idea would be to catch a vehicle either in the turn lane to go North on Arthur or East on W 18th Avenue.  With it set back how it is, we miss this information.
		 
		P052 at Maxwell Road @ Maxwell Connector EB.  Can this also be moved more to the East?  How its stationed now we miss anyone coming off of the Maxwell Connector.  I would prefer it in a location between the Maxwell Connector and N. Park Avenue still looking to the East.
		 
		Derek
		 
		Detective D. DeWitt
		Financial Crimes Unit
		Special Weapons and Tactics Team
		Background Investigations Team
		Eugene Police Department
		300 County Club Road
		Eugene, OR 97401

			Detective DeWitt,
			
			 
			The location has been updated. Please review it on your Deployment Plan https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker/public/0f92e14e805f30bf6acf29115ee1c582560303a6c2e3e60326f43777d51bbdd9e1bdc878e527a9fa0d2d6abff6fb4732a1214533e1b5baac57072823bc00b731  and let me know if you approve of its placement. Once you approve we can add it to the locations that require a city permit.
			 
			Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
			 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
			 
			 
			On Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 6:59?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
				Here are the coordinates. 
				(44.0404460, -123.1247610)
				 
				Derek

thread_messages.subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]
				Hi Detective,
				 
				Understood and thank you for taking the time to look into it. GPS coordinates always help us get placement right the first time and avoid any back and forth. To get the coordinates, right click on the preferred install location on Google maps and then copy the coordinates that come up. Once you share these with me I can have your map updated.
				 
				Regards
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
				 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
				 
				 
				On Wed, Apr 9, 2025 at 10:52?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
					I don�t know if I am going to be able to get to yes with the private property request for the location we spoke about along I-5.  Reading through the ODOT setbacks allowed for property owners, I believe it would work, I just don�t know if I am going to be able show it which obviously would be an issue.  So lets move that camera, so we can complete the mapping and permitting process without delay.
					 
					After looking at our best available options, I would like to place that camera on West 18th Avenue, looking East, just prior to Arthur Street with the intent to capture vehicles in the turn lane to northbound Arthur Street and eastbound West 18th Avenue.  
					 
					Let me know if you have questions about the exact placement or any issues with that intersection.  
					
					Derek
					 
					Detective D. DeWitt
					Financial Crimes Unit
					Special Weapons and Tactics Team
					Background Investigations Team
					Eugene Police Department

thread_messages.subject: Re: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]
					HI Detective,
					
					 
					Thank you for taking my call about location F015. Per it, you are going to see about locating a parcel map showing the boundaries of this private property. Our records show the property line starting at about 70' from the I-5 which is too far for our cameras. You thought this might be inaccurate so once you are able to gather a little more info, we should be able to clear up where the property lines are and what the best install location will be.
					 
					Regards
					 
	
 
Matt Triana
Project Manager



 
					 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/N8dQjWVQ3Zda.png> 
					 
					 
					On Tue, Apr 8, 2025 at 10:31?AM DEWITT Derek A <DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov DDeWitt@eugene-or.gov > wrote:
					Good morning,
					 
					I checked the Deployment Tracker map and it looks like all updates were added with the exception of one.  F#015 is a duplicate of one just further to the West.  We were moving that one to private property to catch a view of I-5 southbound.  That camera location will be 89733 Armitage Road (Johnson Vegetable Farms).  I sent pictures and Google map pins to show the purposed location in a previous email.  I just wanted to make sure that was on your radar.  We have verbal permission from the property owner who said he would sign the associated form.  I can provide his name and phone number as well.
					 
					Thank you all for your continued work on this,
					
					Derek
					 
					Detective D. DeWitt
					Financial Crimes Unit
					Special Weapons and Tactics Team
					Background Investigations Team
					Eugene Police Department
					300 County Club Road
					Eugene, OR 97401
					Work hours: Tuesday - Friday 7:30 a.m. � 5:30 p.m.
					Desk Phone � 541-682-2682
					Work Cell � 541-743-6192

thread_messages.subject: OR - Eugene PD Phase 1 + Flock Safety
thread_messages.body:
[EXTERNAL ?]
					Hi Captain & Detective,
					 
					Thank you all for your time today on the kick off call.
					 
					To recap, we are installing: 57 of our LPR cameras on a mix of existing poles, standard 12' Flock poles, and MASH test poles (ODOT locations). The majority of these fall within city and county ROWs with a handful falling ODOT ROW. Per our call, at this time we are pending the official 'yes' from ODOT.
					 
					Our permitting team is diligently working to secure the necessary approvals. We acknowledge that this process can be time-consuming, and we assure you that we will provide timely updates as soon as permit approvals are obtained. If you come across contacts for anyone within 
					 
					Here is also the deployment tracker link we discussed. The Deployment Tracker [link https://planner.flocksafety.com/planning-portal/deployment-tracker ] will be your go-to resource for
